qas.question: What was the first institute of technology in the world?
What war led to the increased popularity of institutes of technology and polytechnics?
What was the founding name of the Braunschweig University of Technology?
In what year was the École Polytechnique founded?

context: The institutes of technology and polytechnics have been in existence since at least the 18th century, but became popular after <a1_0>World War II<a1_0/> with the expansion of engineering and applied science education, associated with the new needs created by industrialization. The world's first institution of technology, <a0_0>the Berg-Schola<a0_0/> (today its legal successor is the University of Miskolc) was founded by the Court Chamber of Vienna in Selmecbánya, Kingdom of Hungary in 1735 in order to train specialists of precious metal and copper mining according to the requirements of the industrial revolution in Hungary. The oldest German Institute of Technology is the Braunschweig University of Technology (founded in 1745 as "<a2_0>Collegium Carolinum<a2_0/>"). Another exception is the École Polytechnique, which has educated French élites since its foundation in <a3_0>1794<a3_0/>. In some cases, polytechnics or institutes of technology are engineering schools or technical colleges.
